productions.description: A RealTest script is parsed as a sequence of lines (each optional statement followed by a newline).
Lines may be blank (no statement) or contain one of the defined statements.
Comment lines begin with optional whitespace followed by // text.
Key/value lines follow the pattern KEY : VALUE (value optional).
Section headers such as `Import:` with no inline value.
Free-form text lines (e.g., multi-line notes) without a colon.
Accepts optional leading spaces, colon delimiter, and trailing value payload.
Handles section headers that rely on indentation for their body.
Whitespace followed by // comment text up to end of line.
Lines without a colon are captured as TEXT after optional indentation.

notes: The PEG grammar is intentionally permissive, treating RealTest as a key/value language while preserving full line content in VALUE or TEXT tokens.
Indentation semantics are not enforced; downstream tooling can interpret VALUE/TEXT strings for nested meaning.
Both Lark (PEG) and ANTLR grammars are emitted for downstream tooling integration.
